Issues.Title: OnAfterRender / OnAfterRenderAsync
Issues.Body:
Gives components notification when rendering has occurred. This makes it possible to perform additional initialization, such as activating third-party JS libraries that want to operate on the rendered DOM elements.

I've chained this PR onto #685 because I wanted the E2E test to cover the combination of these two features, as it's the most interesting and important use case.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "OnAfterRender / OnAfterRenderAsync" (#691)

Issues.Title: Expose getRegisteredFunctions from Blazor javascript module
Issues.Body:
Should be possible expose the getRegisteredFunctions from Blazor javascript module.

This could be useful in custom interop solutions like this one for promises:

https://joonasw.net/view/csharp-await-and-js-promises-in-blazor

doesn't require 'host' the functions in the window object. Just use the same approach to register the function to be called.

The implementation could be this one:

`let promise = Blazor.getRegisteredFunction(fnName)(data)`

instead this one:

`let promise = window[fnName](data);`

BWT, could Blazor include a solution like this one https://joonasw.net/view/csharp-await-and-js-promises-in-blazor to call promise (async/await).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Expose getRegisteredFunctions from Blazor javascript module" (#688)

Issues.Title: Added OnRemove and OnRemoveAsync method on BlazorComponent
Issues.Body:
Added **OnRemove** and **OnRemoveAsync** method on **BlazorComponent**.

Like the opposite of OnInit and OnInitAsync, theses methods are overridable, and will be called once when disposing in ComponentState.DisposeInBatch method.

This way we can leverage some specific event based on type or data or whatever.

My actual needs were more for caching some component somewhere, like some "singleton" component, but being able to track them if any dispose occur, in order to free their reference/existence somewhere in my app for consistency and security.

I searched for an existing unit test for this case, something like OnInit, but i didn't find it.

Tested on the template project, with a nested component in a foreach loop, then leaving the page, checking that OnRemove was called.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Added OnRemove and OnRemoveAsync method on BlazorComponent" (#684)

Issues.Title: Use Blazor just for client side C# code in place of JavaScript (no UI)
Issues.Body:
I don't know if this is already possible or not, but could Blazor be used just for getting C# working as client-side code in place of JavaScript, while keeping the regular html / css rendering? 

If I could preempt one comment: No, I'm not trying to replace every day little client-side javascript, but for more significant use cases. 

Here's one example: See this [blazedown](https://www.telerik.com/blogs/blazedown-experiment-with-markdown-and-blazor) experiment. Like him, I happen to be using MarkDig on the backend to render markdown, while for the ongoing preview while client types, I make calls to the backend every half second etc to render an html preview panel of the document (yes, I could use, as I did originally, one of the javascript based MD renderers, but without going into details, this way gives me consistent *and* better results to what I'm doing on the backend for rendering). It would be terrific if MarkDig could be compiled and used client-side with Blazor, using whatever it does to get .NET working with webassembly on the client, without replacing the UI. So I'm envisioning a way to probably use javascript to call functions in the webassembly / blazor .NET code. Or is that just not possible?

Thanks y'all
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Use Blazor just for client side C# code in place of JavaScript (no UI)" (#681)

Issues.Title: Blazor lib projects JS may need access to 'platform ready' event
Issues.Body:
While experimenting the new Blazor library projects (which is awesome btw) we've hit a wall when using Blazor APIs.

To repro just create a blazor library project and at the .js file, call this:

```
const callbackMethod = Blazor.platform.findMethod(
  assemblyName,
  namespace,
  typeName,
  methodName
);
```

Add this project to a Blazor app project and just run it.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4714040/39224046-7ec5e3a8-481b-11e8-8c04-5f062af6059c.png)

The project build actions looks like is adding the content properly to the index.html as the scripts are added _after_ mono.js import...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4714040/39224087-b8d3a81e-481b-11e8-86fc-8c0df4986583.png)

So, how to workaround this?

It looks to me that all `Blazor.xxx` objects are properly defined in JS except the `Blazor.platform.xxxx`...

Issues.Title: Json serialization on RegisteredFunction.Invoke includes members with null value
Issues.Body:
If I'm not mistaken, I think that serializer includes members having a null value, so if I have a type
```
class Tubo {
  public string Text { get; set; }
}
```
and I serialize new Tubo(), I'd get
`{ Text: null }`
instead of
`{}`
This is a problem when you don't want to pass properties around.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Json serialization on RegisteredFunction.Invoke includes members with null value" (#664)

Issues.Title: Cannot get out of Blazor app when using base tag
Issues.Body: # Description Given this documentation : https://blazor.net/docs/host-and-deploy/index.html#app-base-path If our app is located in "/a" we should change the base tag by `` we can deploy our Blazor app in virtual directory of our server. But once on the app all the link to other virtual directory on the server are broken. # Actual behavior With the following base tag `` If we add a link in the app like this `Account` Once we click on it, the console will displays a router error > 'Router' cannot find any component with a route for '/manage/index'. This is because of the method "isWithinBaseUriSpace" in https://github.com/aspnet/Blazor/blob/dev/src/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Browser.JS/src/Services/UriHelper.ts it calls "toBaseUriPrefixWithTrailingSlash" which ignores the last part of the base URI we set in the base tag. If I set this base tag `` I get the following error on first load > Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token < # Expected behavior Blazor let the browser query the page "/manage/index" # Suggested solution Change the behavior of toBaseUriPrefixWithTrailingSlash and just check if baseUri ends with a slash and adds it if it doesn't. I can send a PR if you agree on this solution # Temporary solution Manage navigation with vanila js (document.location = xxx) # System spec Blazor 0.2.1 Web server Asp.Net core 2.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cannot get out of Blazor app when using base tag" (#668)

Issues.Title: Floatingpoint numbers lose their comma in JsonUtil
Issues.Body:
JsonUtil seems not to honor the comma in floatingpoint numbers.

This JSON
```{"MyNumber": 100.99}```

Mapped to this property:
```public decimal MyNumber {get;set;}```

Will end up with the number `10099` in MyNumber when deserialized with JsonUtil.

I've tried setting the Culture and UICulture (which seem to be empty by default) in my `Main` of the blazor app, but that doesn't seem to help.

Anybody already tackled this?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Floatingpoint numbers lose their comma in JsonUtil" (#669)
